Function Documentation

i32 GU_add_amp ( i32  xstart,
i32  precols,
i32  datacols,
i32  postcols,
i32  ystart,
i32  prerows,
i32  datarows,
i32  postrows,
i32  xdetstart,
i32  ydetstart,
i16  type,
i32  rotate,
i16  flip,
i32  extension,
i32  detno,
i32  ampno,
i32  discard 
)

Adds a new detector into structure. See GU_call_add_amp()

First, convert any angle to a value [0, 359] degrees. Second, the only allowable angles are multiple of 90 (90, 180, 270). Third, then rotation on 180 degrees can be avoided by changing the amplifier definition with the following rule: Change from Lower to Upper anf from Righr to Left (and vice-versa), which means, the opposite, diagonal type

Now, all flips can be avoided just changing the amplifiers definitions using this rule: For Horizontal Flips, a Lower amplifiers change to an Upper amplifier (and vice-versa) For Vertical Flips, a Right amplifier changes to a Left amplifier (and vice-versa) This implies that, for example, a LL flipped vertically is a LR, and flipped horizontally is an UL

i32 GU_add_det ( i32  xstart,

i32 GU_add_subimage ( ptr_t  genptr,
ptr_t  subimptr,
i32  subxstart,
i32  subystart,
i32  subcols,
i32  subrows,
i32  totalcols 
)

Adds an the image in the specified subimage buffer in the specified position in the output buffer. The position here means geometryc position rather than index position. This is used, for example, to compose detector data (when detextor extensions are enabled)

Parameters:
[in] genptr pointer to general (complete, output) image buffer
[in] subimptr pointer to subimage to be added
[in] subxstart lower left x position of subimage in complete image (genptr)
[in] subystart lower left y position of subimage in complete image (genptr)
[in] subcols number of columns in subimage
[in] subrows number of rows in subimage
[in] totalcols number of cols in complete (general) image

i32 GU_det_ext ( i32  flag  ) 

Enables or disables unscrambling per detector instead of per amplifier. This causes the output unscrambled buffer to be ordered by detector instead as per amplifer [in] flag enable(1) or disable(0) per detector unscrambling

void GU_dlclose ( void   ) 

Closes unscrambling algor

i32 GU_dlopen ( char *  algorpath  ) 

Opens reference to unscrambling algorithm

Parameters:
[in] algorpath name of the algorithm to be used to unscramble

i32 GU_do_detextensions ( ptr_t  outbuff,
i32  nelems,
i32  chunkrows 
)

Performs the rearranging of the amplifier data so it gets blended into a detector. IN other words, takes the data of each amplifier ibn a given detector and puts them toguether so the complete detector data gets togueter and can be later passed to the fits server to be written as a "detector extension"

Parameters:
[in] outbuff output buffer pointer
[in] nelems number of elements (pixels) in each amplifier
[in] chunkrows number of rows to blend

ptr_t GU_FLOAT ( ptr_t  rptr,
ptr_t  imageptr,
i32  nelems,
i32 *  err 
)

Unscrambling routine called for FLOAT datatype (32 bits per pixel, float). Selected automatically (dinamically) when the datatype is set in the routine GU_compute() If detector extenions are selected (see GU_det_ext()) then it calls automaticall GU_do_detextensions()

Parameters:
[in] rptr pointer to raw (incoming) pixels. This is the buffer where the scrambled pixels are.
[in] imageptr pointer to output buffer. This is the bufefr where the unscrambled data will be wri tten
[in] nelems number of elements (pixels) in the raw buffer
[out] *err status out

ptr_t GU_LONG ( ptr_t  rptr,
ptr_t  imageptr,
i32  nelems,
i32 *  err 
)

Unscrambling routine called for LONG datatype (32 bits per pixel, integer). Selected automatically (dinamically) when the datatype is set in the routine GU_compute() If detector extenions are selected (see GU_det_ext()) then it calls automaticall GU_do_detextensions()

Parameters:
[in] rptr pointer to raw (incoming) pixels. This is the buffer where the scrambled pixels are.
[in] imageptr pointer to output buffer. This is the bufefr where the unscrambled data will be wri tten
[in] nelems number of elements (pixels) in the raw buffer
[out] *err status out

ptr_t GU_NONE ( ptr_t  rptr,
ptr_t  imageptr,
i32  nelems,
i32 *  err 
)

Unscrambling routine when unscrambling is disabled. It basically copies the raw data into the amplifers data without changes

Parameters:
[in] rptr pointer to raw (incoming) pixels. This is the buffer where the scrambled pixels are.
[in] imageptr pointer to output buffer. This is the bufefr where the unscrambled data will be wri tten
[in] nelems number of elements (pixels) in the raw buffer
[out] *err status out

[in] chunkrows number of rows to arrange

i32 GU_SetPhysMap ( ptr_t  array,
i32  num_elements 
)

Sets the physical map between amplifiers and output extensions

Parameters:
[in] array array of integers with the order. The array index is the amplifier, the value the output position
[in] num_elements numbe rof elements in the array

ptr_t GU_SHORT ( ptr_t  rptr,
ptr_t  imageptr,
i32  nelems,
i32 *  err 
)

Unscrambling routine called for SHORT datatype (16 bits per pixel, integer). Selected automatically (dinamically) when the datatype is set in the routine GU_compute() If detector extenions are selected (see GU_det_ext()) then it calls automaticall GU_do_detextensions()

Parameters:
[in] rptr pointer to raw (incoming) pixels. This is the buffer where the scrambled pixels are.
[in] imageptr pointer to output buffer. This is the bufefr where the unscrambled data will be written
[in] nelems number of elements (pixels) in the raw buffer
[out] *err status out
